MAIN_INFO_DOCUMENTATION_DESCRIPTION: The documentation to this application is available as a separate .zip file delived with the release. You can run the index.html to read up on the code.
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_DESCRIPTION: If you never worked with NDExEdit before, here are a few first steps you might want to try out:
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_STEP_1: Visit the NDExBIO Website and select a network you would like to edit visually
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_STEP_2: Enter this network's URL or UUID into the downloader under "Manage" or select a local .cx file
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_STEP_3: Inspect the information displayed to this specific network by clicking on the i-Icon right next to the networks name
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_STEP_4: Click on "Edit" to manipulate how the graph is displayed
MAIN_INFO_STEPS_STEP_5: You can download the adapted graph as .cx file
MAIN_INFO_LAYOUT_DESCRIPTION: To modify the proportion of main view and sidebar click the bar between the two:
MAIN_INFO_LAYOUT_STEP_3: Ctrl + Left click resets the proportion to default
MAIN_STATS_TT_COMPARE: Compare this edit to another one
MAIN_GRAPH_TT_FIT: Fit graph to current page layout
SIDEBAR_MANAGE_REMOTE_FILE_TIP: You need the network's URL or UUID to load the file from NDEx
SIDEBAR_MANAGE_FILE_TYPE_LABEL: The loaded file needs to have the .cx file extension. Your file currently has the extension
SIDEBAR_MANAGE_FILE_ELEMENT_COUNT: The network contains too many elements for this application
SIDEBAR_EDIT_LABEL_HEX_NODE: Nodes highlighting (hex color codes as such #FF00FF)
SIDEBAR_EDIT_LABEL_HEX_EDGE: Edges highlighting (hex color codes as such #FF00FF)
SIDEBAR_EDIT_TT_MANAGE_MAPPINGS: Manage existing mappings and create new ones
MAIN_MAPPINGS_DELETE: Delete all style properties mapped by this attribute
MAIN_MAPPINGS_TT_DELETE: All above defined style properties are deleted by this
MAIN_MAPPINGS_CONFIRM_DELETION: Are you really sure you want to delete the mapping above?
MAIN_MAPPINGS_SINGLE_CONFIRM_DELETION: Are you really sure you want to delete this property from the mapping?
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_INSTRUCTIONS: Create a new mapping here. The selected attribute's values are listed in the form below. Each of these values can be mapped to a specific CSS value. Enter the CSS property's key into the specified field to map it by your selected attribute. Validation if such a CSS property exists is not provided.
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_TT_DISTRIBUTION: View distribution details for this property
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_CSS_HINT: Enter the name of a CSS property you wish to map
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_COLOR_PREVIEW: Validate your colors by toggeling previews
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_COLOR_HINT: Colors must begin with # and have six letters
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_ALREADY_EXISTS: A mapping for this attribute-css-combination already exists
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_EDIT_INSTEAD: Creating a second one is usually a bad idea. Do you want to edit the existing one?
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_DEFAULT_HINT_1: Dont't let default values confuse you. They are needed for the NDEx data model, but they don't impact your mapping directly.
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_DEFAULT_HINT_2: To define a consistent mapping it's recommended to set values for your attribute's minimum and maximum. You can find them as grey fields in the form below.
MAIN_MAPPINGS_NEW_DEFAULT_HINT_3: Check out the histogram to inspect your data. There are buttons that let you change the bin size.
SIDEBAR_COMPARE_ABOUT_1: Do you like this app? There's a lot more to come!
SIDEBAR_COMPARE_ABOUT_2: NDExEdit was developed as a bachelor thesis at University of Augsburg
